meanings.definition: Relating to or marked by alliteration.
meanings.sent1: The alliterative poem had many repeating sounds.
meanings.sent2: The alliterative writing style made the story flow smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The alliterative title of the book was catchy and fun to say.
meanings.sent4: Her alliterative speech was like a melody of matching sounds.
meanings.sent5: The alliterative nature of the song lyrics made them easy to remember.

meanings.definition: Using the same consonant sound at the beginning of each word in a phrase or sentence.
meanings.sent1: The alliterative tongue twister was challenging to say quickly.
meanings.sent2: The alliterative phrase 'Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers' is famous.
meanings.sent3: The alliterative sentence about silly snakes made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His alliterative poem painted a picture with perfectly paired words.
meanings.sent5: The alliterative nursery rhyme was a joy to recite aloud.
